data.name: label69.ToolTip
data.value: You can define the sort order for the respective view. Mostly, "Ascending" is the best choice. For fields like "Date" or "Rating" it is useful to use "Descending". You can set separate sort orders for the view itself, the underlying film list and optional hierarchy film lists.

data.name: label66.ToolTip
data.value:
The Value will allow you to directly display the film list filtered to that value. Practically, a rule "DBfield like *Value*" will be used - but other than Filter Expression, this is affecting the display (Film list instead of grouped view).
Important: If this field is set, My Films will directly display a film list and skip any "grouped" View. Use "*" to show complete filmlist.

data.name: Config_Name.ToolTip
data.value: Enter a unique name for each configuration. You can have more than one configuration referencing a single database, or multiple configurations referencing multiple databases. Configurations can be password protected in the 'Security' section below, to restrict access to children for example.

data.name: Config_Dflt.ToolTip
data.value: Check this box for the configuration that you want to be loaded each time the plugin is accessed. If you have more than one configuration, and there are no configurations selected as the default, you will be prompted to select a configuration the first time. Subsequently, the most recent configuration used will be loaded.

data.name: Config_Menu.ToolTip
data.value:
If you have defined several configurations, you can choose to display the Choose Config Menu when entering the plugin. 1. On - displays a list of Configs whenever you open the plugin 2. Off with view defined - Displays configs on first entering My Films, but not after reentering - returns to last config 3. Off without view defined - displays last config when reentering plugin
Note: You can't select that option if a Default Config is defined.

data.name: cbAllowTraktSync.ToolTip
data.value:
If enabled, TRAKT plugin is allowed to synchronize your movie data for this config to the TRAKT site.
Notes: You can enable this for multiple configs. Do only enable for movie collections. It is not recommended to enable for private videos or documentaries, as there is usually no movie data available on Internet databases.

data.name: SLogo_Type.ToolTip
data.value:
There are four fields referenced in the skin files to display logos - ID2001, ID2002, ID2003 and the combined ID2012.
You can nominate which logos that you want to see in one of the three skin fields by referring to these ID numbers. The combined field ID2012 will automatically have all definitions of ID2001 and ID2002.
For example, you can define rules for genre in ID2002 and type of movie (DivX, Xvid, HD...) in ID2001.
If the skin designer has defined two physically distinct fields, you will see two separate logo images. However, if the two fields are defined with the same x and y position values, those two logo files are concatenated and only one image containing both the logos is displayed.
This latter situation is most often the case.

data.name: chkLogos.ToolTip
data.value: Select this option if you want the following logos to be displayed for selected items. You can select an existing rule for modification by clicking in the list. Editing is done by changing the settings on the bottom. You have to click "Update Logo Rule" to store changes to the rule.

data.name: LogoView.ToolTip
data.value: This is the overview of all your defined Logo rules. Each line presents a rule, that is checked for logo display. You can add new rules by setting the rule in the lower part of this screen and press "add" to add it to the rule set. If you select a rule, you can edit / change it. To store changes, you have to click "Update Logo Rule" - otherwise changes are not permanent.

data.name: txtLogosPath.ToolTip
data.value: Enter (or use the browse button) the full path to the folder containing the logo image files. To optimise performance, an image containing all the logos to be displayed for each movie is dynamically created. Those cached images usually are stored in ...\thumbs\MyFilms\ThumbsCache\MyFilms_Logos If you leave the field empty, logos will be searched in ...\skin\<skin name>\media\logos. Thus the default rules will try to assign logos of the current selected skin, if available. You can use Presets to use default behavior, use B3W logos or use optional logo pack.

data.name: comboBoxLogoPresets.ToolTip
data.value:
You may choose from several presets to help you getting started. However you can define your logo rules yourself if you want. For user defined logo rules, the fully qualified path to a logo is stored in the rule, so it might not be fully portable.
"Use skins default logos" is the default and will search for logos in the ...\skin\media\logos and it's subdirectories for logos matching the name in the logo rule. It should work in most situations.

data.name: Fanart.ToolTip
data.value:
Select the 'Use Fanart' option if you have image files to be displayed as background fanart. Enter the full path (or use the browse button) to the root folder containing the fanart image files. There will be one sub-folder for each movie, that can contain images with any name. If there are multiple images, they will all be loaded in details view.
Select the option 'Use movie cover for missing Fanart' to have the movie's DVD cover displayed as a background image for movies without a matching fanart file. Be aware, that using that option will often create fanart image of low quality because of low resolution of cover images and you might get a distorted picture as covers and fanart don't have the same size. Therefore it is recommended to enable 'Use the default image for missing fanart'.
Note: When scanning and importing new films, My Films (AMCUpdater) will limit the download to 3 images by default. You may alter these options in AMCU Settings on the Database Fields tab under picture handling. You may also download additional fanart images from within My Films.

data.name: chkFanartDefaultViews.ToolTip
data.value:
If enabled, fanart will be used for group views. My Films will auto-create sub-folders for you. Images placed in those folders will be used for fanart display in the default group views (category, year, genre).
If disabled, default fanart will be displayed, if it is enabled.

data.name: groupBox22.ToolTip
data.value:
Select the 'Use thumbs for group views" option if you have image files to be displayed as cover image replacement in grouped views. Images for "Views" like Genre, Year, Country, etc. - excluding "person like" Views - see Person Views.
These image files must have the same name as the list item of the group, e.g. "2010.jpg" or "action.png". Enter the full path (or use the browse button) to your folder containing the view thumb image files.
Select the option 'Use the default movie cover for missing thumbs' if you wish to use a movie cover when no thumb for views is available.
You can also use fanart for those views, to do so, put fanart in the sub-folder for year, category, country, e.g. <fanartfolder>\\_view\\year\2010"; The setting for this path is done via the Fanart path setting automatically; See "Fanart for default group views - path" below.

data.name: pictureBoxDefaultViewImage.ToolTip
data.value: Click to select the image file that you wish to use as the default view image. The default view image will be displayed for the "grouped" views, like "Country", "Year", etc. when a view does not have specific associated photo or image and it will be used as a default view image.

data.name: btnResetThumbs.ToolTip
data.value: That action will remove all generated cache thumbs for group views. (Your original images will not be deleted.) This is only required, if you replaced existing (and already cached thumbs) with new ones to let My Films (re)create the cache.

data.name: MesFilmsViews.ToolTip
data.value: This path is the "root folder" for group thumbs. The respective thumbs will be loaded from sub-folders, named like the views you choose - e.g. <country>\<countryname.jpg> You can place a "default.jpg" in the respective sub folder that will be displayed when no specific thumb can be matched.

data.name: groupBox1.ToolTip
data.value: Use this area to define a path where cover images are stored. This is mainly required, if you have only image names without full path stored in your DB. You can also define a default cover, that will be used, if there is no cover defined or found for a movie record.

data.name: pictureBoxDefaultCover.ToolTip
data.value: Click to change Default Movie Cover. The default cover image will be displayed when a movie entry does not have an associated cover image and it will be used as a default fanart image if the appropriate Fanart option is selected in the 'Picture' section, and a movie entry does not have an associated fanart image.

data.name: txtPicturePrefix.ToolTip
data.value:
You can define a prefix for the cover images that will be added to the image name. This is useful, if you store all images for different configurations in the same directory. There are 3 possible scenarios: 1. adding image name prefix (e.g. "AntDB_") 2. adding subdirectory for image covers, that is sub-folder of the catalog directory (e.g. "moviecovers\") 3. Both of the above (e.g. "moviecovers\AntDB_")
This setting is used, if you grab new pictures with My Films to determine the location where to store them.

data.name: cbPictureHandling.ToolTip
data.value:
This defines how cover images are stored to your catalog. The setting cannot directly be modified - My Films automatically sets it based on settings you choose for your catalog path, your Picture prefix and the path you select as "Cover Image Path".
Options: Full Path - stores the full path in the catalog. Relative Path - stores only the relative path in the catalog. The "relative path" option is only possible, if you're defining a sub path to your catalog file. If you do select a path that is NOT a sub-folder of the catalog file, this setting will require "Full Path".
If the Cover Images Path is the same as the catalog directory, this setting should be "Relative Path" and only the image name will be stored in the catalog.

data.name: MesFilmsImg.ToolTip
data.value: Enter the full path to the folder containing the DVD cover image files ' by default it is the same as the path to your database file. You can use the browse button to find the correct path. My Films Setup has some logic to help you to set Picture Prefix and Picture Handling, so in certain cases you just have to select the path with the browse button and Setup will automatically populate or change them accordingly. Remark: If you choose a sub-folder to your catalog directory, My Films setup will automatically split the path and set this path to the catalog directory and the rest of the path to the Picture Prefix.

data.name: groupBox_ArtistImages.ToolTip
data.value: Use this area to define a path where artist thumbs (images for persons) should be stored. Works same way as cover images for movies. It is used for "person like" Views, like actors, director, producer, writer.

data.name: pictureBoxDefaultPersonImage.ToolTip
data.value: Click to select the image file that you wish to use as the default person image. The default person image will be displayed when a person does not have an associated photo or image and it will be used as a default person image.

data.name: btnResetThumbsArtist.ToolTip
data.value: That action will remove all generated person image thumbs. (Your original images will not be deleted.) This is only required, if you replaced existing (and already cached thumbs) with new ones to let My Films (re)create the cache.

data.name: MesFilmsImgArtist.ToolTip
data.value: Enter the full path to the folder containing the person image files. Matching will be done based on images filename that matches the person's name. You can use the browse button to find the correct path.

data.name: groupBox_AMCupdater.ToolTip
data.value: For updating the whole database and scan for and add new movies to your catalog automatically, including grabbing media info, Internet movie data, cover image and fanart. You can use and launch AMCUpdater in batch mode from inside the My-Films GUI or schedule a task to run independently from MediaPortal / My Films.

data.name: chkAMC_ImportOnInternetFail.ToolTip
data.value: when running global update/import, import files even when internet lookup fails. This is the preferred setting for background operation, if you prefer to have your media files imported, even if the internet lookup is failing. It gives you the possibility to update the internet infos interactively in MyFilms.

data.name: chkAMCUwatchScanFolders.ToolTip
data.value: If checked, MyFilms will watch your scan pathes when it is running and launch AMCupdater, if a change is noticed. This allows to automatically let MyFilms launch AMCupdater in the background whenever a movie is added or removed to or from your scan pathes. Note: If you add or remove movies while MyFilms is not running, it won't detect changes, so you have to either manually start an import or enable the "Scan on Startup".

data.name: chkAMCUscanOnStartup.ToolTip
data.value: If checked, MyFilms will launch AMCupdater in the backround when first started to check and import new movies. Note: It will use the dettings, you have made in AMCupdater setup for imports, so verify them if they match your needs.

data.name: txtAMCUpd_cnf.ToolTip
data.value: Choose the config file for AMCUpdater that should be used for the scheduled run. My Films will create such a file for each Configuration Name. You find those files in the MediaPortal data directory and they are named "MyFilmsAMCSettings_<Configuration Name>". However, if you created your own configs in AMCUpdater GUI and saved it somewhere else, you can also choose those.

data.name: scheduleAMCUpdater.ToolTip
data.value: You can use the Windows scheduler to schedule AMCUpdater to run and update automatically to update your catalog. Make sure the configuration you choose for this matches your needs. Note: You can always launch AMCUpdater from within My Films anytime you wish and let it import movies in the background. If you prefer that, you do NOT require to schedule a task via scheduler.

data.name: AmcTitleSearchHandling.ToolTip
data.value:
Options are: File Name: use file name for title field Folder Name: use folder name for title field Relative Name: use whole content of path for title
File Name + Internet Lookup Folder Name + Internet Lookup Relative Name + Internet Lookup
All the same as above, but adding Internet lookup, trying to get a matching movie and then replacing title with the title found by the Internet grabber.
Example: So if you have named your files by movie title, select 'title'. If you have your movie files in folders, that have the movie title, select 'folder'.

data.name: btnCreateAMCDefaultConfig.ToolTip
data.value: My Films will create a default configuration for AMCUpdater based on your current My Films Configuration. This configuration is used, when you start AMCUpdater from the setup or the created desktop icon. You might want to recreate this configuration, if you have changed settings in My Films setup and AMCUpdater setup and want to create a new default setup. In normal usage this is not required, as saving My Films config also pushes changes to AMCUpdater config file. Note: This will overwrite your existing AMC Updater settings file - so you'll lose customizations you made.

data.name: chkAMC_Purge_Missing_Files.ToolTip
data.value:
Checks your Ant Movie Database catalog for references to files which no longer exist. If enabled, AMC Updater will remove entries from your DB, when movie file(s) cannot be found in your movie folder or sub-folders! Use with care and make sure, you really want to remove films from your DB, that are not accessible during update scan !
Entries with sources outside the scan directories are not purged automatically - only entries with sources within the active scan folders will be purged automatically. For example, an entry listing a Source of 'd:\Movies' will not be considered an orphan if you only scan 'e:\Other Movies'.
Also check your AMCUpdater settings, as there are options to configure how updating behaves: - If you update DB with AMCUpdater, AMCUpdater should recognize that the film moved and just update source - (adjustable in AMCUpdater setup). - If you moved the file, update and the movie is no longer available, the record will be removed ('purged') from your DB and disappear. - There are settings in AMCUpdater to PREVENT it from purging files - even when movie files are NOT available during scanning - this is mostly for DVD-drives, but can also be used for USB-attached drives. This makes sure entries won't be removed from DB - and if you start a film in My Films, it won't find film and will ask you to insert media.

data.name: chkAMCUpd.ToolTip
data.value: If checked, the global update options will be available in My Films to run AMCUpdater in the background, scanning for new movies, adding them to your catalog and and loading data for it. Loading data includes: - reading media info via mediainfo.dll - getting Internet info via the selected Internet grabber script - getting cover image via the selected Internet grabber script - loading fanart

data.name: groupBoxDeletionOptions.ToolTip
data.value:
The automatic Deletion Options allow you to update and/or delete records and/or media files after the corresponding movie is watched - or manually via the context menu.
ATTENTION: Be careful - enabling delete options can delete not only the record in your database, but also the movie linked to it! Update DB = update the record with settings of "Player finished Update Action" Delete DB entry = delete the record from the DB Delete Movie file = PHYSICALLY DELETES your movie from storage medium.

data.name: gpspfield.ToolTip
data.value:
This defines the action taken, when the player finishes. You can update e.g. the "checked" field with a value "true to indicate "watched status". However be careful not to activate the delete options ("Delete Options", otherwise the physical source files would get deleted after player finishes!
You will have the option in the GUI to switch to "unwatched movies only" - based on the update of the "checked" field

data.name: chkSuppressAutomatic.ToolTip
data.value:
When enabled, the selected actions are automatically performed after a movie is watched.
Note: If physical removal is selected, your movie files will be deleted from disk after you watched it - handle with care !

data.name: groupBox2.ToolTip
data.value:
This option allows AMC users to update field info for storing your "watched status" - AMC4.x users even have to possibility to keep record of watched info and user rating for multiple users - either local ones or Trakt users, the latter allowing syncing with Trakt website (see MUS).
You can choose a field to be used for "watched status" - a good recommendation is "Checked" or the new extended "Watched" field in AMC4. You can choose to update this field when starting a movie or when playback is finished. You can update e.g. the "checked" field with a value "true" to indicate "watched status". However be careful not to activate the delete options ("Delete Options", otherwise the physical source files would get deleted after player finishes! You will have the option in the GUI to switch to "unwatched movies only" - based on the update of the "checked" field

data.name: btnWatchedImport.ToolTip
data.value: You can import a formerly created backup file of your watched status. Important: Importing a status will OVERWRITE the content of the field, that you have configured for "Field used for Watched Status" ! All former content will be lost after this operation - so choose this action with care and only if you know what you are doing. If you are not sure, take a backup of your XML catalog file before you start.

data.name: btnWatchedExport.ToolTip
data.value: You can export the current content of the watched field for your database to an external file. Main purpose is to take a backup of your watched status, when you e.g. plan to make changes on your config. You could also use it to "move" your watched data from one field to another: - port your current settings - Change the "Field used for Watched Status" - Import your watched data As a result, the content will have been copied to the new field. A useful case is, if you used "checked" field in that past, but want to change to "Enhanced Watched Status Handling" - as this requires the use of a field that supports text content (like e.g. media info or borrower).

data.name: textBoxGlobalUnwatchedOnlyValue.ToolTip
data.value:
By Default, unwatched items are identified by having either "false" or "" (empty) in the related field. The field used for watched / unwatched status can be configured in the Update Tab.
However, you can define a value other than that, if you require it.

data.name: cbWatched.ToolTip
data.value:
Choose the DB field you want to use for the Watched Status Handling. By Default, "Checked" field is used.
Notes: If you use other field than "Checked", you should make sure, it's content matches your needs. E.g. using "Media Label", but having that field already populated with content other than "Value to identify unwatched items" would result in getting all movies displayed as "watched". So you might have to clear that field first and make sure that it will not get populated accidentally (e.g. AMCUpdater Media label) or set Value for unwatched to the Value you set to the field by default.
If you are using "Enhanced Watched Status Handling" and use AMC, you should select another field than "Checked", as AMC handles Checked field as "boolean" - while Enhanced Watched Status handling required a text field (When saving in AMC3 you would loose enhanced infos). A good recommendation is "Borrower" (AMC3) or the new extended "Watched" field in AMC4 when using Enhanced/Multi-user Watched Status Handling.
If you use a field that is already populated, it might initially show your movies as "watched" - e.g. when using "Media Label" and having imported movies with AMCUpdater's default settings, Media Label will be populated with "AMCU".

data.name: btnMUSdeleteUserData.ToolTip
data.value: "Delete User Data" allows you to remove the MUS (Multi User Status) data for a specific user. This is useful, if you added a user once but don't use it anymore - you want to keep all MUS data, except for that user. Warning: all user data will be removed from your DB and cannot be restored, including user rating, watched dates, watched counts and watched state.

data.name: UserProfileName.ToolTip
data.value: You can set a "User Profile Name" that will be used for watched status handling. This is useful, if you want the watched status kept separately for different users. If you checked "Enhanced Watched Status handling" you can select the user in the hidden menu ("Options" - "Global Settings ...") in My Films GUI. The user "global" is always existing and is counting global watched status.

data.name: groupBox_UserItemsDetails.ToolTip
data.value: You can enter a unique label and select a database field for any additional information you wish to have displayed for a movie. As this can be skin dependant, some experimentation may be required to see what can be displayed and where it might appear. These are user defined items for the details screen. You can also change the assignment in My Films GUI (Options - View Options).

data.name: groupBox_UserItemsMain.ToolTip
data.value: You can enter a unique label and select a database field for any additional information you wish to have displayed for a movie. As this can be skin dependant, some experimentation may be required to see what can be displayed and where it might appear. These are user defined items for the main screen. You can also change the assignment in My Films GUI (Options - View Options).

data.name: groupBox_Separators.ToolTip
data.value:
Genre, country and actors are grouped in unique fields in the database and sometimes there are multiple entries in each of these fields which may be separated by commas - for example Genre = 'Comedy, Comedy Romantic, ... The actual separators used can vary depending on the web-site used to grab the movie information.
When using the 'Search' function, the plugin needs to know exactly which separators are used in your movie database. A pre-defined list of separators is already given.
For actors, their names are often followed by a role (Clint Eastwood (Inspector Harry), or Clint Eastwood as Inspector Harry,... ). The plugin needs to know what separator is used to indicate the role text for finding or searching on actors.
Note: Separators will need time to process - for person views (e.g. actors), you can speed up the view significantly by defining only those separators you really need.

data.name: groupBox_DefaultView.ToolTip
data.value: Select from the list, the view you want to see when first entering the plugin. Select the option 'Always use Start Settings', if you always want to see this view and settings for this configuration, when returning to My Films. If you do not select the option 'Always use Start Settings', the last view used before exiting the plugin will be shown next time when reentering.

data.name: chkReversePersonNames.ToolTip
data.value: If checked, Person names (like Actors, Directors, etc.) will be "reversed". This is useful, if you prefer to have lists starting with last name, but Internet grabber provide the names as "first Last". Example: Internet grabber results in "Bruce Willis" Reverse Person Names changes this to "Willis, Bruce".

data.name: chkShowEmpty.ToolTip
data.value: This option allows you to display also groups of empty values, e.g. if you select a view by category, you will get an additional group in the view with films having no category assigned. This is useful, if you want to make sure, all your films are included in a specific view or if you want to check films without values.

data.name: groupBox4.ToolTip
data.value:
In movie hierarchies, normally the same sort order is used as in all other views. If you prefer a different sort order once you entered a movie group (hierarchy, collection), you can define a different sort order here.
Example: You usually browse your movies sorted by rating, descending to alway have highest rated movies at the beginning. You are using movie hierarchies / collections, like e.g. Star Trek\Star Trek 1 Star Trek\Star Trek 2 If you enter the movie collection (here 'Star Trek') you prefer to have the movies sorted by year, ascending to have them in a better order. To achieve that, choose "Year" and "ASC". Note: the settings apply for ALL orders whenever you enter a hierarchy group, including single movies or multiple second level hierarchies.

data.name: chkGlobalAvailableOnly.ToolTip
data.value:
"Only available" option acts as global overlay filter for all views and this setting is used for start view. It can be switched on/off from the GUI during runtime. So you should only activate this if you want to filter your views always when entering My Films.
Note: The availability status is only usable after My Films has done a scan. This can be enabled at startup on the General tab by checking the 'Scan media on start' option. Scan might take some time, depending on the size of your DB and location of your movies (e.g. NAS).

data.name: chkGlobalUnwatchedOnly.ToolTip
data.value:
Unwatched option acts as global overlay filter for all views and this setting is used for start view. It can be switched on/off from the GUI during runtime. So you should only activate this if you want to filter your views always when entering My Films.
AMC users can configure the field and value to identify unwatched films on "update" tab (Watched-Status Handling).

data.name: AlwaysDefaultView.ToolTip
data.value:
Enabling a Default Start View will disable 'remember last item/view', what is the normal behaviour. This results in always the selected view will be displayed, when starting the MyFilms plugin with this config. If you enable "Always use start settings", the Default Start View will be applied each time you enter My Films, otherwise only the first time, you enter - afterwards My Filoms would remember your last view and settings.
Note: You can save the start settings for film lists and groups in the GUI, when you're in such a context - layout, sort field and sort direction would then be updated.

data.name: groupBoxView.ToolTip
data.value: Views by 'Category', by 'Year' and by 'Country' and by 'Actor' are already defined by default. In this section you can define additional views; select the database field, enter a label for that field to be displayed in the menu, and then enter a value for the field. If there is no value entered, a menu will be displayed for the range of values available in the database. If a value is entered, a list of the movies with that value will be displayed. Optional: - If you want to use a list of values, you can add them as comma separated values. - You can set Index to values of 1 or 2 to get indexed display of the values - You can define a Filter same way as "Config Filter" to restrict or limit the results

data.name: AntViewsImage.ToolTip
data.value:
Preview of Cover Image loaded for this View. Click to open dialog to choose a custom one.
If no image is selected, My Films will try to use default images, were possible - so even if you have not defined an image here, you might get a default image displayed in GUI.

data.name: toolStripButtonDelete.Image

data.name: groupBox5.ToolTip
data.value:
"Filter Expression" allows you to apply filter rules, that limit the results. Other than "Value", it will keep "grouped Views" as display and not directly show a film list of the results - allowing you to have views like "Category, Year, etc. - so Filter Expression can be used as Filter to allow free combinations of any conditions users might want. My Films helps you to create such conditions, but if you're familiar with MS Expressions, you can use them directly too.
That filter can be combined with "Value", e.g.: You want all your action movies directly as film list from last 30 days (DBfield Category, value 'action', filter 'ageadded') You could do the same in the past by using different configs based on same catalog - as Filter works same way as config filter. But now, you don't need separate configs, just for that. You still might want to use different configs, if you e.g. want to have password protection, etc.

data.name: groupBox24.ToolTip
data.value: The Trailer section allows you to use a selectable DB field to store trailer source path infos and thus to integrate trailers into My Films. Trailer can be searched within the plugin and "auto-registered". GUI can display if a trailer is present (registered) and play it. By default, the search includes media files in the directory of the main movie and it's subdirectories, searching for media files containing "trlr" or "trailer" in the filename. So to enable My Films to find and register trailers, you can drop them in the movies directory or a sub folder and make sure they are named accordingly (many downloader utilities do it this way). You can add an additional trailer search path that will search for and register media files containing the movie's title.

data.name: cbCacheOnlineTrailer.ToolTip
data.value: If enabled, MyFilms will automatically cache trailers in views where online trailers are provided,e.g. "Filmography (TMDB) or Online Content. This allows to get a local playback option presented and allows to play HQ trailers even when internet or server bandwith is low. Cached trailers are stored in the Extended Trailer Searchpath, subdirectory "OnlineTrailerCache" - so this must be defined.

data.name: cbTrailerAutoregister.ToolTip
data.value:
When checked, My Films will auto-register trailers in the movie directory when entering the details view of the movie. This is mainly intended to ease the registering of trailers downloaded by OnlineVideos plugin into the movie directory and does not replace the full register scan.
Note: Using this option will update your DB whenever you enter the Details View and there is trailers found. Disable the option, if you don't want regular writing to your DB.

data.name: PathStorageTrailer.ToolTip
data.value: Enter or select the path for extended search for trailers. My Films will try to find matching media files based on the title chosen for trailer search and media files in subdirectories containing the movie name. You can add more than one search path by separating them with semicolon, e.g. "path1; path2". If you choose a new path it will be added to your existing path(s).

data.name: AntStorageTrailer.ToolTip
data.value: Choose the DB field where My Films should store the info about the source path of trailers. For AMC3.x users, "Borrower" is a good recommendation, as it's not commonly used. AMC4.x users should use the "Source Trailer" field that was introduced for this purpose (and keeps Borrower free). However make sure, you do not use this field for other purposes (e.g. seen status) If you use external ANT movie catalog to edit this field manually, you can add more than one movie by separating them with semicolon. e.g.: "\\server\path\trailer1.flv;C:\Movies\trailer2.flv" When using the trailer search & register, My Films will automatically populate this DB field for you.

data.name: groupBox_AntSelectedEnreg.ToolTip
data.value:
If you wish to filter records to be displayed, or records to be excluded for this particular configuration, select the database field/s, select the appropriate operator/s and enter a value for that field/s.
For example, if you have a configuration of movies for children to watch, and you wish to exclude 'adult' movies, then store a specific code (e.g. 'XXX') in an unused field in your ANT database and define a filter to not include films when that field value equals 'XXX'. Define this configuration by default and a menu of other configurations will not appear, so children will not be aware of any other configurations.
Adult movies can then be included in another configuration that is password protected.
Alternatively you could define a "white list" config for children: Category LIKE '*Children*' will include all movies, that have Children as part of the Category Category LIKE 'Children' will include all movies, that have Children as Category
Supported filter operators: = like not like < > # executed as "<>" in (requires a list of allowed expressions) not in like in (operates like a sequence of "field like '*valuex*' having comma separated values as a list

data.name: groupBox3.ToolTip
data.value:
If you wish to filter records to be displayed, or records to be excluded for this particular configuration, select the database field/s, select the appropriate operator/s and enter a value for that field/s.
For example, if you have a configuration of movies for children to watch, and you wish to exclude 'adult' movies, then store a specific code (e.g. 'XXX') in an unused field in your ANT database and define a filter to not include films when that field value equals 'XXX'. Define this configuration by default and a menu of other configurations will not appear, so children will not be aware of any other configurations.
Adult movies can then be included in another configuration that is password protected.
Alternatively you could define a "white list" config for children: Category LIKE '*Children*' will include all movies, that have Children as part of the Category Category LIKE 'Children' will include all movies, that have Children as Category
Supported filter operators: = like not like < > # executed as "<>" in (requires a list of allowed expressions) not in like in (operates like a sequence of "field like '*valuex*' having comma separated values as a list

data.name: AntFilterSign1.ToolTip
data.value:
Supported filter operators: = like not like < > # executed as "<>" in (requires a list of allowed expressions, placeholders not allowed) not in like in (operates as a sequence of "field like '*value1*' OR field like '*value2*' ... )
Examples: "Number IN (1, 2, 3)" // integer values "Number NOT IN (1, 2, 3)" // values not from the list "Translated Title IN ('Matrix', 'Avalon', 'Star Trek')" // string values "Original Title LIKE 'j*'" // values that start with 'j' "Actors LIKE '%jo%'" // values that contain 'jo' "Category NOT LIKE 'j*'" // values that don't start with 'j' "Category # 'Action' AND Category <> 'Horror'" "Category NOT IN ('Action', 'Horror')" "Actors IN ('Bruce Willis', 'Adriano Celentano')" "AgeAdded_Num < 30" // only show movies added last 30 days

data.name: groupBox_PreLaunchingCommand.ToolTip
data.value:
You can define here a command batch file to be executed before each movie launch. In the parameter field, select the item field of your database passed as parameter to the command file.
Very unused...

data.name: tbExternalPlayerExtensions.ToolTip
data.value: Here you can define the extension that will launch the external player automatically, if the execution path is defined. Multiple values can be separated by semi colon (";"). If you leave this field empty (and have a path to a player defined), you will still be able to start playback with external player via context menu.

data.name: chkScanMediaOnStart.ToolTip
data.value: If checked, My Films will automatically scan all media files (films, trailer) to check if they are currently "reachable". This is useful if you have stored parts of your movies on storage that is not always available, e.g. USB drives or NAS servers. The scan can also be launched from GUI in global options.

data.name: SearchOnlyExactMatches.ToolTip
data.value: If checked, only files with exact matching with search name will be "auto-started". Example: Search name = "movie", filename = movie.avi. If unchecked, also files that only contain a part of the search title will be auto-started. Example: Search name = "movie", filename = "movie divx.avi"

data.name: PathStorage.ToolTip
data.value:
Enter the full path to the folder(s) containing the movie files. You can enter several different paths separated by a semi-colon and you can select the option 'search in sub-folders', if required. You can also use the browse button to locate the correct folder(s).
This setting is optional, if 'DB Item for Movie Source Info' is configured and you have populated that source field with proper data - however, it CAN be configured to allow My Films to search for movies, if it can't find them in 'DB Item for Movie Source Info'.
The setting is mandatory, if you do not use the 'DB Item for Movie Source Info' - in this case this is the way My Films searches for the movies to play.

data.name: ItemSearchFileName.ToolTip
data.value: If the media file is not found with the 'Ant Item for Storage Info' field, you can search for the file with the movie name. Choose the title used for the search. Note: This setting is optional and not required, if you populate your "DB Item for Movie Source Info" with fully qualified path to your media files.

data.name: AntStorage.ToolTip
data.value:
Select the field in your AMC database that you have used for the movie's file name / path information.
This field in the AMC database can contain a single filename or multiple file names separated by a semi-colon. If the movie comprises many files, then you could also use a playlist file (.m3u), or an image file (.iso, .bin) or a folder name (containing DVD files or .avi files).
If you have configured a "Path for Movies File Search", the filename is sufficient, otherwise the field requires the fully qualified name including path to the movie file.

data.name: AntIdentItem.ToolTip
data.value:
For offline movies - that is, if a movie file cannot be located (neither by the Movie Source Info, nor by searching) - a pop-up window will advise you that the movie cannot be launched. In the first field, select the database item to be displayed containing the Media/Disc ID where the movie is stored (usually Media Label). In the second field you can enter your own text message to provide additional information.
This is for users using offline library content, like DVD and BR discs or USB drives.

data.name: groupBox_Security.ToolTip
data.value:
You can set a password on a config. Selecting that config will then ask the user to enter the password. This is useful to deny access to certain movies, e.g. having all adult movies in a separate config and set a password.
Note: If you have a password on the default config, each time you enter My Films the user will have to enter the password.

data.name: CatalogType.ToolTip
data.value: Select the type of xml catalog file (AMC, DVDP, MyMovies, ...). Types other than AMC will have a temporary file generated each time the original file is modified (based on the 'date modified'). The generated file is fully compatible with AMC and is stored in the same path as the original file and named 'Catalog_File_without_extension'.

data.name: groupBox_TitleOrder.ToolTip
data.value:
Title selection: You can set the mapping of the master title, secondary title and sort title to DB-fields to match your catalog.
Grouping: Using a hierarchy separator in the title field(s) in your catalog allows you to do grouping of your films and have a hierarchical presentation. This can be used to group more than one movie together, e.g. for collections.
Example: Hierarchy Separator: "\" movie 1: Moviecollection\movie1 movie 2: Moviecollection\movie2 movie 3: Moviecollection\movie3
Will show "Moviecollection" with 3 items in it.

data.name: label17.ToolTip
data.value:
Character used for hierarchical presentation. This can be used to group more than one movie together, e.g. for collections.
Using a hierarchy separator in the Original or Translated Title field in your movie database allows you to group your films in My Films presentation.
You get grouping by adding the separator to the respective content of the title fields.
Example: Hierarchy Separator: "\" movie 1: Moviecollection\movie1 movie 2: Moviecollection\movie2 movie 3: Moviecollection\movie3
Will show "Moviecollection" with 3 items in it.

data.name: TitleDelim.ToolTip
data.value:
Character used for hierarchical presentation. This can be used to group more than one movie together, e.g. for collections.
Using a hierarchy separator in the Original or Translated Title field in your movie database allows you to group your films in My Films presentation.
You get grouping by adding the separator to the respective content of the title fields.
Example: Hierarchy Separator: "\" movie 1: Moviecollection\movie1 movie 2: Moviecollection\movie2 movie 3: Moviecollection\movie3
Will show "Moviecollection" with 3 items in it.

data.name: AntTitle1.ToolTip
data.value: Select the ANT database field that you want to be displayed as the 'Master Title'. You can use hierarchies for "grouping" when defining a hierarchy separator and use it in the content of your catalog's title field.

data.name: groupBoxExtendedFieldHandling.ToolTip
data.value: My Films internally supports more than just the Ant Movie Catalog (AMC) fields. However, you might prefer to add those fields to standard ANT fields for display reasons: Your skin only shows standard ANT fields (external catalogs) and you need the user defined items to display other fields in the skin.

data.name: btnLaunchAMCglobal.ToolTip
data.value: Starts AMCUpdater (external application) with the created configuration file. With AMC Updater you can interactively update your DB with Internet data, scan directories for files to add them to your DB and show your catalog and edit the content. It can run independently from My Films.

data.name: buttonDeleteTmpCatalog.ToolTip
data.value: If you changed you external Catalog settings, they will only apply, if an import is done in My Films. This import will happen, if the time-stamp of the external catalog data is changed/updated - e.g. when the data was refreshed. However, you can force to import the data by deleting the My Films cache DB.

data.name: buttonOpenTmpFileAMC.ToolTip
data.value: You can launch Ant Movie Catalog (AMC) to open your My Films cache-tmp file. However, you should be aware, that only for native AMC config editing from inside AMC is possible AND reflecting the changes in My Films. If you are using an external catalog, all changes will be overwritten on next export from you external catalog - so AMC should only be used for read-only.

data.name: AMCConfigView.ToolTip
data.value:
List the content of the AMCUpdater configuration options. Those options are used to create the Default Config and when launching AMCUpdater from My Films setup or via the desktop icon.
Note: This config will be created for AMCUpdater when you first create a My Films config. It won't be updated, until you press button "(re)create Default Config". This is to make sure, My Films won't overwrite any settings that you may have done in AMCUpdater itself.

data.name: btnHyperLinkParamGen.ToolTip
data.value: You can create start parameters for use on buttons anywhere in MediaPortal. Select the configuration, views, layout or search parameters, create the start parameters and copy the resulting hyperlink as hyperlink parameter to the button anywhere in your skin.

data.name: groupBox_GrabberOptions.ToolTip
data.value:
You can update your movie data via Internet from inside My Films GUI.
You have to define the xml parser file ("grabber script") to be used.
With the 'try to find best match automatically' option enabled, the grabber will try to find best match but can provide errors in some cases. It's better to don't enable it. In that case, you'll get a menu to choose the right movie.
You can change those options from My Films GUI (global settings) also.

data.name: ItemSearchGrabberScriptsFilter.ToolTip
data.value: You can filter the Grabber scripts that should be displayed in the selection menu. Usage: - use ";" or "," as separator - use 2-letter language codes for country/language selection (e.g. "en" for English, "de" for German) - use "all" to display grabber scripts for multiple languages - leave empty or use "*" to show all available grabber scripts - if no scripts match your restriction, your list might result empty.

data.name: txtGrabberDisplay.ToolTip
data.value:
Set the default grabber script for updates within My Films. If you selected "Don't use default script", you still can choose to use another script - but default script will always appear as first entry.
For global override settings, that affect possibly any grabber script, see "My Films Grabber Override Options".

data.name: chkGrabber_Always.ToolTip
data.value: If checked, My Films will choose the best match automatically. If unchecked, you'll get possible matching movies presented in a list to choose manually yourself. Automatically matching best result may lead to wrong information for a movie.

data.name: btnEditScript.ToolTip
data.value:
This launches the My Films Grabber Interface. The current default script will be auto-loaded. You can set user defined options or switch to expert mode to modify the grabber script in detail.
Remark: Changes to the Grabber Options will apply to the script, so all My Films configs that use it, will be affected. If you want those settings to only apply to a certain My Films config, you should save the script with a separate name and set this as default grabber script.

data.name: groupBox6.ToolTip
data.value: You can set several options for the Internet grabber. Be aware, that not all options are supported by all grabber scripts. However, IMDb (full) script should support all options listed here. If you set no values, the default settings of the grabber will be used instead. The default settings (of the grabber script) can be changed by editing the grabber script in the "My Films Grabber Interface" ("Grabber Options").

data.name: cbGrabberOverrideLanguage.ToolTip
data.value:
Preferred Language(s) for Translated Title(s) and Certification
Depending on the abilities of your grabber script, you can set a language/country here to tell the grabber to get related info. Most Internet sites only support titles for different countries - IMDB-Full script also supports Certification for different countries. Note: To use Certification, you have to map that data to one of the standard fields of your ANT Movie Catalog. Note: You can add more than one language/country using comma separated values. Example: You would like to grab titles for Germany and Canada you set "Germany, Canada". As the drop-down only allows choosing one value, multiple values have to be entered manually.

data.name: chkGrabber_ChooseScript.ToolTip
data.value: If unchecked, you will be asked to manually choose the script to use for Internet data update. If checked, the Default script will always be used. You can change this setting also from inside My Films GUI in global options.

data.name: txtGrabber.ToolTip
data.value:
Choose a default grabber script to be used for Internet data update in My Films GUI. Grabber script files are located in the mediaportal data directory in \scripts\MyFilms after installation.
This setting will also be used to set the script as default script for AMCUpdater configuration - however you can change AMCUpdater settings in the GUI to use any other settings.

data.name: btnFirstTimeSetup.ToolTip
data.value:
The "Setup Wizard" allows you to create new My Films Configs with presets to get quickly a working config without worrying about all detailed config options.
Usually, My Films will be used with external catalog software, thus you have an existing catalog and will just configure My Films to use it.
For users willing to create a new configuration from scratch, this setup wizard can be used. It enables you to create a new My Films configuration by just entering some basic infos: - A configuration name and - the path to an existing movie catalog, if you want to use it - the folder to scan for your movies
It will basically do the following: - Create a new empty catalog file (ANT-MC format) or use the one you selected - Preset many of the values in My Films - Set IMDB Internet grabber as default
This will give you a quick way to test My Films right away. You still can tweak all settings later to your personal preferences.
Note: If you want to test or do skinning, but don't have a working catalog, you can select the "SampleMovies.xml" catalog. In that case, it is also recommended to select "USA (Full Detail Grabbing)" (default) in Country drop-down, this will preset the IMDB-Full grabber for you and make sure, your DB will be populated with extended fields as well.

data.name: btnServerSync.ToolTip
data.value:
Central Configuration - Network Setup: The Network Client Setup allows you to setup your My Films Client in networked environments with central storage. A network server has to be running and a central config must be present.
Do NOT use this, if running standalone HTPC - using this setup type will overwrite your local config file !!!
Note: If the Automatic Sync on startup is enabled, the local config will be disabled.

data.name: groupBox_UpdateGrabberScripts.ToolTip
data.value: Updating Grabber Scripts will download missing grabber scripts from online site and update existing grabber scripts, if there is an update with higher version number available. If an existing grabber script will be updated, a backup file will be created in a sub directory "backup" with the extension of the update date and time (useful, if you had customized the default grabber script(s)). If you are sure you don't need the backup files, you can delete them via "delete script backups".

data.name: groupBoxMultiUserState.ToolTip
data.value:
MUS (Multi User States) option is automatically set, depending on your selected catalog type. It will be enabled, when using AMC4.x catalog type and disabled when using AMC3.x catalog type.
Note: Support for MUS (formerly EWS - Enhanced Watched Handling) has been discontinued for AMC3.x catalog types!
If enabled, watched status will be stored with extended info: - Watched count in user context (if a user context is set) - Watched date (date movie was watched last time) - User Rating (if the user has either set it manually or by Trakt rating dialog after movie is watched)
Watched count in user context requires a user profile name to choose. By default, the user name is "empty" and this "user" will have the default states for watched, user rating, etc.
It is updated each time a movie is launched together with 'date watched'.
Note: "Global" values will be available to skin representing aggregated values, like - total watched count of all users - last watched date of all users - best rating of all users
The "global count" will increase each time any user is watching a film thus representing "total plays".

data.name: Config_EnablePreload.ToolTip
data.value: If checked, MyFilms will try to load the config and database in init phase (startup of Mediaportal). Entering the plugin the first time will be much faster, especially on networked environments. However, this does not work, if you have a config set that requires a password or if you have chosen to always choose the config on startup.

data.name: labelTraktDescription.Text
data.value:
"Trakt.TV" actively keeps a record of what TV shows and movies you are watching. Based on your favorites, your friends, and the community, trakt recommends other TV shows and movies.
You need to have the Trakt plugin installed and configure a user account. If you don't have a user account, you can register on Trakt website.
To successfully use Trakt with My Films, you have to both allow My Films to provide data to Trakt plugin by enabling Trakt here and you have to enable My Films in Trakt setup (setup or from GUI)
You can enable or disable Trakt synchronisation separately for each My Films config.

data.name: label41.Text
data.value:
Development: Guzzi, Zebons, Orion Hall, Titof Wiki Docs: Dadeo, Guzzi Skinning: Dadeo, ysmp, Guzzi MF logos: Dadeo, Guzzi Genre images: Carlos 'Fiinix' Nabb (Fiinix Design) Testing: Dadeo, z3us, ncoH, TLD Project Management and Design: Guzzi, Dadeo Grabbers Scripts: Guzzi, z3us
Special thanks to Dadeo: Without him, this former private version would never have made it to a public release!

data.name: label28.Text
data.value:
My Films is an extension to support users who already have invested time and energy to develop extensive movie catalogs using movie catalog software. It provides an 'out of the box' solution to use your movie catalog in MediaPortal without needing to rescan or re-download your data and artwork. My Films allows you to manage your movie collection in either one of the supported external catalogs, with the supplied AMC Updater or even from within My Films plugin itself.
My Films is designed to combine the powerful features of movie catalog software with the superb media center features of MediaPortal.

data.name: btnTestMode.ToolTip
data.value: "Test Mode" enables features or changes that are not yet ready for stable releases. You should only enable, if you want to help testing those features. Please report your findings in the My Films forum.
